item.description:
We are excited to announce the very first Drupal Camp Connecticut to be held at Yale University in New Haven, CT on Saturday, August 28, 2010 - a full day, no cost event including knowledgeable speakers, informative workshops, birds-of-a-feather sessions and invaluable opportunities to network with other Drupalists in and around the Nutmeg State.

Registration is now open and must be made at http://www.drupalcamp.... Space is limited - so register today!

We are also seeking proposals for speakers, workshops and birds-of-a-feather sessions, help with organization of the conference, and individual and corporate sponsors, as well as general suggestions for DrupalCampCT 2010 at our recently launched website: http://www.drupalcamp....

Modeled in the camp unconference structure, Drupal Camp Connecticut is a no-holds-barred discussion/workshop/code-a-thon structured around the open source content management system, Drupal (http://www.drupal.org...). In the spirit of the unconference we are very much open to ideas, and welcome any folks who are interested the opportunity to schedule a session or suggest a session. At DrupalCamp, you ask the questions and the experienced users provide the answers. At DrupalCamp, you discover your solutions to your most pressing problems.

DrupalCampCT will be hosted at Luce Hall, Yale University. Pre-planned sessions will be held in four break out rooms. There will also be a large lounge area for smaller impromptu groups or Birds-of-a-Feather sessions.

Join us at Yale later this month, and help make our first DrupalCampCT a memorable success!

group.name: Northampton Web Developers/ Web Designers Meetup Group

item.name: Drupal Camp Connecticut
